title: Colts apologize to Fins' Hill for now-deleted video
content: The Colts issued an apology to Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill and Microsoft on Thursday after deleting their schedule release video Wednesday night.

title: WNBA GM survey: Collier MVP over Wilson, Clark
content: The WNBA's GMs picked the Lynx to win the 2025 title and Napheesa Collier as their most likely MVP, over A'ja Wilson and Caitlin Clark.

title: NFL to vote on player participation in '28 Games
content: NFL owners will vote next week on a resolution that would allow players to participate in flag football during the 2028 Olympics.

title: QB Williams sought to avoid Bears, book details
content: Quarterback Caleb Williams looked to find a way around the NFL's collective bargaining agreement in an effort to avoid being drafted by the Chicago Bears, details from a forthcoming book reveal.

title: 'Go out and do it again': Wolves return to WCF
content: The Timberwolves are back in the Western Conference finals for the second straight year after closing out the Warriors with a 121-110 win in Game 5 on Wednesday night.

title: Warriors had title shot if Curry healthy, Kerr says
content: The Warriors credited the Wolves and avoided excuses but acknowledged the impact of injuries to Stephen Curry and Jimmy Butler as their season ended.

title: Kapanen's OT winner propels Oilers to West finals
content: Kasperi Kapanen scored on a scramble in front of the net at 7:14 of overtime, and the Edmonton Oilers beat the Vegas Golden Knights 1-0 in Game 5 on Wednesday night to advance to the Western Conference finals for the second year in a row.

title: Madrid's Asencio may be charged for explicit video
content: Real Madrid defender Raúl Asencio and three former teammates from the club's youth teams could face criminal charges for allegedly recording sexual images of a woman and a minor and distributing them without their consent.

title: Creativity shines as NFL teams unveil schedules
content: The 2025 NFL schedule was released Wednesday, prompting unique reveals by multiple teams on social media.

title: The 49ers are back! Trouble for the Cowboys! Let's overreact to the NFL schedule reveal
content: Will the 49ers roll into the playoffs? Can the Giants, Lions and Cowboys overcome tough slates? Let's size up schedule reveal fallout.

title: Nikola Jokic is defying stat-chasing culture -- and he's still an MVP front-runner
content: Jokic's half-court heaves are bad for his final stat lines, but the three-time MVP will do anything to help his team win.

content: Which quarterbacks landed in perfect spots? We look at expectations, fits and roles for all 13 drafted QBs, including two first-rounders.

content: It's been a bad season for Pep Guardiola and Man City, and it's clear they're in a full rebuild mode. Who has a future on this team?

title: Müller says goodbye as Bundesliga's dramatic final day looms
content: Thomas Müller already said farewell to the Bayern Munich faithful. Now he'll wave goodbye to Bundesliga.

title: Sources: Madrid set to sign Huijsen before CWC
content: Real Madrid have reached an agreement in principle to sign Dean Huijsen from Bournemouth for £50 million before the Club World Cup, sources told ESPN.

title: Haaland: City must find stomach to win trophies
content: Erling Haaland has said Manchester City must rediscover the "stomach" to fight for the biggest trophies after branding this season "catastrophic" for Pep Guardiola's side.

title: Amorim: UEL final places on line vs. Chelsea
content: Ruben Amorim has told Manchester United's stars that they risk being left on the bench for the Europa League final if they don't perform against Chelsea.

title: FIFA gets complaint over Saudi WC human rights
content: A group of international lawyers filed a formal complaint to FIFA on Thursday claiming the soccer body is failing to uphold its human rights policy with 2034 World Cup host Saudi Arabia.

title: Aina: Offside flag could have averted Awoniyi injury
content: Forest's Aina has said the injury that saw Awoniyi placed in an induced coma could have been avoided if the the offside flag had gone up in time.

title: Sources: Maresca set for Chelsea stay, UCL or not
content: Enzo Maresca is set to remain as Chelsea manager regardless of whether they qualify for next season's Champions League, sources have told ESPN.

title: Mascherano: Miami must learn how to suffer
content: Javier Mascherano said his team needs to learn how to "suffer some moments" if it is to make progress and get better results than Wednesday's 3-3 draw.

title: 'Devastated' Ajax on verge of title collapse
content: Ajax conceded a 99th-minute equaliser against Groningen on Wednesday which has left their Eredivisie title hopes on the brink in one of the most monumental collapses in football history.

title: A-Rod among well-wishers on Jayson Tatum's postsurgery Instagram post
content: The star forward recently completed surgery on his right Achilles tendon that was ruptured on Monday.

title: Jayson Tatum's injury timeline and what to learn from other NBA stars' Achilles tears
content: Following Tatum's devastating Achilles injury Monday, what has recovery looked like for other NBA stars?

title: New NBA mock draft: We project all 59 picks
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's our updated two-round mock.

title: Amid growing pains at Ferrari, will Hamilton win in F1 again?
content: Lewis Hamilton is not accustomed to losing, but he's been doing a lot of it. Will that ever change at Ferrari?

title: UFC Fight Night: Does Burns have a best path to ending Morales' unbeaten run?
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Shiv Sena announces ₹10 lakh reward for leads on Pahalgam terrorists
content: The Jammu & Kashmir police have already announced a cash prize of ₹20 lakh. The party will add ₹10 lakh to it.

title: SC collegium recommends Karnataka HC judge K. Somashekar as Chief Justice of Manipur High Court
content: A three-member collegium headed by CJI Gavai in its meeting held on May 15 recommended the appointment in view of retirement of incumbent Chief Justice D. Krishnakumar on May 21

title: Amit Shah meets security personnel injured in anti-Naxal operation
content: Five security personnel were injured in the 21-day anti-Naxal operations on the Chhattisgarh-Telangana border, which concluded on May 11

title: Protests in Goa over NIO hydrologists’ report claiming Mahadayi river diversion will have limited impact on the coastal State
content: The legal dispute between Karnataka and Goa over the sharing of Mahadayi river water has lasted over two decades

title: A textbook with a difference
content: All 84 illustrations of Kerala reader - Malayalam for Class IV are done by women artists and female students

title: Aviation security regulator revokes security clearance for Turkish airport ground handling company
content: “The security clearance is hereby revoked with immediate effect in the interest of national security,” according to an order from the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security issued on May 15.

title: Speedy decisions need of the hour: Kerala Chief Minister
content: Pinarayi Vijayan addresses regional-level review meeting on the development projects in Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam and Pathanamthitta districts

title: SRMIST commits ₹1 crore to PM relief fund to help kin of Pahalgam victims
content: T.R. Paarivendhar, Founder-Chancellor, SRMIST, conveyed the institute’s condolences and unwavering support through a letter addressed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Forest officials file preliminary offence report against Peddireddy and family members
content: The charges pertain to the construction of a structure by Mr. Ramachandra Reddy in the reserve forest area, which was in violation of the Forest Act

title: Miss World 2025 contestants soak in Telangana’s cultural tapestry at Bhoodan Pochampally
content: The contestants learnt the intricacies of the weaving process, closely observing artisans at work and even trying their hand at spinning yarn using rattan; captivating beats of traditional Kinnera and Dappu instruments add to the rhythm

title: City police arrest lawyer accused of assaulting junior woman colleague
content: Police will record his detailed statement and produce him before the Judicial First Class Magistrate court on Friday

title: Canal rejuvenation under IURWTS likely to ease waterlogging in Kochi
content: Edappally canal, Perandoor canal, Chilavannoor canal, Thevara canal, Market canal, and Konthuruthy canal will be rejuvenated under the project

title: After postal ballot-tampering remark kicks up a row, G. Sudhakaran does a U-turn
content: Former Minister and senior Communist Party of India (Marxist) says he spoke with a bit of imagination. “I have never engaged in or facilitated bogus voting. Postal ballots were not tampered with. I was only giving a warning to union members who did not vote. I have conveyed this to the election officials who came to record my statement,” he says

title: Lokesh on three-day visit to Anantapur
content: From the inauguration of wind energy plant to participating in JNTU-Anantapur convocation, Minister has packed schedule

title: A.P. teachers to continue protest against G.O. on school restructuring
content: Unions plan to send messages to HRD Minister from May 16 urging him to withdraw the decision to set up nine categories of schools, which they claim will harm the education sector

title: Knowledge Kerala project: facilitation centres to be set up in Ernakulam
content: The facilities will act as a support system to help job seekers and provide them with adequate training

title: Belagavi Police register suo motu case against fake news on Sofia Qureshi
content: A post on X, now deleted, said RSS activists ransacked the residence of Col Qureshi’s father-in-law at Konnur in Gokak taluk of Belagavi district

title: Krishna University achieves 100% placement in pharmacy, engineering departments, students get pat from Minister
content: This is the first time that all students were placed during the placement drive at the Krishna University

title: Closure of catering unit in Kochi: no worker in kitchen had health cards
content: Health wing officials had submitted a report on action taken to the Kochi Corporation secretary; stale food seized from the unit was sent to Brahmapuram for disposal

title: Kerala’s borrowing limit for first nine months of 2025-26 set at ₹29,529 crore
content: This includes a ₹4,000 crore that was initially sanctioned as an ad hoc arrangement at the start of the financial year

title: Would Make Gaza A "Freedom Zone", Says Donald Trump In Qatar
content: President Donald Trump on Thursday reiterated his desire to take over the Gaza Strip, telling a business roundtable in Qatar that the US would "make it a freedom zone" and arguing there was nothing left to save in the Palestinian territory.

title: Bengal Teachers Who Lost Jobs Clash With Cops During Protest In Kolkata
content: Teachers who lost jobs after Supreme Court order on "tainted" selection process clash with cops during protest in Kolkata

title: "No Fees! No Limits!": Gautam Adani Praises Adani Vidya Mandir Students For 100% CBSE Result
content: Gautam Adani, Chairman of the Adani Group, on Thursday, lauded the efforts of students and teachers at Adani Vidya Mandir Ahmedabad (AVMA) for scoring 100 per cent results in the CBSE 2025 examination.

title: Singer Chris Brown Arrested Over Suspicion Of Assault At UK Club: Report
content: American R&B singer Chris Brown, the former boyfriend of superstar Rihanna, was arrested Thursday in the UK on suspicion of a serious 2023 assault at a London nightclub, reports said.

title: Adani Airport Holdings Terminates Partnership With DragonPass
content: The Adani Airport Holdings has terminated its association with DragonPass, which provided access to airport lounges, with immediate effect.

title: India, Pak Agree To Continue Confidence-Building Measures: Sources
content: India and Pakistan will continue the confidence-building measures agreed between their two top military officers to end the brief conflict following the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that killed 26 tourists, sources have said.

title: Explained: Why Qatari Jet Gifted To Trump May Need Fighter Escorts
content: A Boeing 747 jet offered to President Donald Trump by Qatar as a temporary flying White House might need fighter jet escorts and could be restricted to flying inside the US unless significantly costly security upgrades were made, Reuters reported.

title: Rape Convict, Survivor Say They Want To Marry, Exchange Flowers In Top Court
content: An unusual scene unfolded inside a courtroom of the Supreme Court on Thursday when a man, convicted of rape and sentenced to 10 years of imprisonment, exchanged flowers with the survivor as the two expressed willingness to marry each other.

title: Turkish Firm Operating At Indian Airports Loses Security Clearance After Op Sindoor
content: The Turkish firm that handles the lion's share of services at nine major airports in India, has lost its security clearance following Turkey's support of Pakistan over Operation Sindoor.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE: Centre Cancels Security Clearance Of Turkish Firm Operating At Indian Airports
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE Updates: Pakistan's nuclear weapons should be brought under the supervision of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) as they are not safe in such a rogue nation, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Thursday.

title: Rare Long-Snouted Vine Snake Spotted In UP's Dudhwa Tiger Reserve
content: A brown morph, long-snouted vine snake, Ahaetulla longirostris, was discovered in the Dudhwa Tiger Reserve, in a landmark herpetological breakthrough, officials said Thursday.

title: Delhi High Court Revises Timings Of Court Sittings, Lunch Breaks
content: The Delhi High Court has revised its timings for court sittings and lunch breaks for judges and staff, a day after the Supreme Court said high court judges were taking breaks "unnecessarily" and too often.

title: 'Explain Delay In Filing Case After Student Suicide': Court To IIT Kharagpur
content: The Supreme Court has taken a serious note of delay in filing a first information report (FIR) into the death by suicide case of a student in the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur.

title: On Camera, Naked Man Breaks Into Bengaluru Shop, Steals Phones Worth Rs 25 Lakh
content: With a mask on his face and a torchlight in hand, a thief entered a mobile shop in Bengaluru with one crucial thing missing - his clothes.

title: "Funds For Banke Bihari Corridor Can Come From Temple But...": Supreme Court
content: The Uttar Pradesh government will be allowed to acquire 5 acres of land near Vrindavan's Banke Bihari temple for a corridor using the temple funds.

title: "Not A Spokesperson": Shashi Tharoor After Congress'  'Lakshman Rekha'  Remark
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday clarified that his comments on the India-Pakistan conflict were made in a personal capacity, as an "Indian and a proud citizen", and did not reflect the official stand of the party.

title: Donald Trump's Big "No Tariffs" Claim, And A Sharp Response By S Jaishankar
content: A day before trade minister Piyush Goyal and a delegation of top negotiators are to arrive in Washington for talks on the proposed India-US trade deal, Donald Trump has let the cat out of the bag by making a huge claim.

title: "Trump Not Getting Enough Credit": Karoline Leavitt Shares Chat With Kashmiri
content: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt claimed a Kashmiri waiter asked her to thank US President Donald Trump for the India-Pakistan ceasefire.

title: After Comments Against Colonel Qureshi, Minister Gets Support From Colleague
content: Hours after the Supreme Court today ordered Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah to "go and apologise" to Indian Army officer Colonel Sofiya Qureshi over his insensitive comments on her, another state minister has come to his support.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Rise Of Indigenous Defence Under PM Modi
content: The Armed Forces launched precision strikes in Pakistan using indigenous missile systems, AI-enabled surveillance drones, and smart munitions.

title: What Marshall, Holm and others signing with MVP means for women's boxing
content: Andreas Hale takes a closer look at the new fighters in the MVP roster and shares his thoughts on the matchups already made.

title: Can Schwarber shine all season? Is Altuve droppable? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: 2025 NFL schedule analysis: Projections, odds, players to upgrade and downgrade
content: The friendliest and toughest slates in fantasy, who makes the NFL playoffs and the race for the No. 1 pick in 2026.

title: Legit or impostor? Predicting whether the NWSL teams defying expectations can keep it up
content: The early-season form of many NWSL teams has been surprising. Let's dig deeper and predict whether this will continue or if it's a blip.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Wrexham target Premier League stars for promotion push
content: Wrexham are planning to move for experienced Premier League players as they look to secure promotion to the top flight. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Mayor contests Behra’s claim on launching boat services through rejuvenated canals in Kochi
content: The services may be feasible only through Edappally, Chilavannoor and part of Thevara-Perandoor canals considering their width. At best, pedal boats can operate in other canals, says Mayor

title: Nellore Rural transformed; 339 completed projects inaugurated in a single day
content: The completed developmental projects include cement roads, drains, parks, and other public amenities and infrastructure

title: India’s trade deficit widens to $8.65 billion in April, services to the rescue again
content: Total exports, including merchandise and services, stood at $824.9 billion in 2024-25, the highest-ever, up 6% from 2023-24

title: Maharashtra Congress chief demands ‘Karnataka and Telangana pattern’ for caste census
content: ‘This census will help determine the exact population of each community, thereby aiding the resolution of the Patidar, Gurjar, and Maratha reservation issues,’ Harshawardhan Sapkal said

title: CM to open Kudumbashree’s 27th anniversary fete on Saturday
content: He will also make an announcement on providing livelihood to three lakh people as part of the Kudumbashree Livelihood Initiative Transformation

title: Rahul’s visit an attempt to revive Congress from its stupor in Bihar
content: The Congress leader might also be looking at a greater seat share in the Opposition alliance for the upcoming Assembly election

title: IIT-H plays host to field demo for advanced Beyond 5G and 6G tech
content: Japan’s Sharp Semiconductor Innovation Corporation, IIT-H and startup WiSig Networks intend to support advanced applications such as Fixed Wireless Access, Mission-Critical Push-to-Talk, V2X autonomous navigation, and satellite-compatible NB-IoT smart metering

title: Shashi Tharoor says he spoke in a personal capacity and as a foreign affairs expert on the India-Pakistan ceasefire
content: The Thiruvananthapuram MP’s statement that India had agreed to a ceasefire at Pakistan’s instance arguably undermined Congress’s demand for a public clarification about the chain of events that led to the ceasefire, particularly in light of U.S. President Donald Trump’s claim about U.S. mediation between the two nuclear powers.

title: Bengaluru to have three corporations under GBG Act, indicates CM
content: The Greater Bengaluru Governance Act, 2024, that has come into effect from May 15, Thursday, provides for one to seven municipal corporations, each with up to 150 wards

title: Sanction free power connection to every eligible farmer, A.P. Energy Minister Ravi Kumar tells officials
content: He also insists on steps to prevent unscheduled power cuts in State and completion of pending projects at the earliest

title: Teachers’ protest turns violent outside West Bengal Education Department office
content: Protesters demand reinstatement without re-examination; former Trinamool MLA heckled, police and RAF deployed to contain unrest

title: In Qatar, Trump once again claims he 'helped settle' tensions between India and Pakistan
content: This is the sixth time since May 10, that Mr. Trump has claimed that the U.S. brokered the “ceasefire” between New Delhi and Islamabad.

title: Fitness check of school buildings under way in Kozhikode
content: The field-level inspection, which will be completed in two weeks, will ensure that the buildings are fit to withstand rain-related challenges

title: Elephant’s death: Konni MLA’s action under Forest department’s scanner
content: Department submits detailed report to Forest Minister. It denies any procedural lapses in summoning a local resident for questioning

title: Wayanad landslides: Cabinet nod for ₹351 crore township project for survivors
content: Approval given subject to the condition that KIIFCON, a subsidiary of KIIFB, issues the technical approval

title: Days after ceasefire, drone wreckage spotted near border in Rajasthan’s Sriganganagar
content: A damaged camera was spotted detached from the unmanned aerial vehicle, which was 5 to 7 feet in length

title: Those involved in Andhra Pradesh liquor scam will not go unpunished, says Excise Minister Kollu Ravindra
content: The SIT will expose all those who have caused a huge dent to the public exchequer, he says, adding that the media houses of former Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy are spreading falsehood on the issue

title: Parampara Sangeetotsava in Dharwad from today
content: Sitar Ratna Samiti is organising the three-day music festival in memory of sitar maestro Abdul Karim Khan

title: Loco running staff stage dharna in Hubballi against injustice being ‘meted out’ to them
content: Members of Hubballi Division of All India Loco Running Staff Association are pressing for their various long-pending demands

title: Telangana weaver presents matchbox-sized silk saree to Goddess Kanakadurga
content: The matchbox-sized silk and gold thread saree is five-and-a half meters long and 48 inches wide and took five days to weave

title: Kottarakara to host Women’s International Film Festival from May 23
content: Three-day festival aims at celebrating women’s voices through feature films and documentaries featuring multiple genres and geographies

title: Detailed project report for ₹327-crore Navalgund Bypass Road approved
content: The Alignment Approval Committee of the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has approved the alignment for 10.575-km bypass road

title: Madhya Pradesh BJP Minister Vijay Shah may find his latest controversy the hardest to dodge
content: Whether he is able to keep his ministerial berth or not will be clear in coming days, but for now, the BJP’s prominent tribal face in the State’s Nimar region struggles to find a single voice in his defence following his remarks on Colonel Sofia Qureshi

title: 'Terror & PoK': EAM Jaishankar spells out terms for talks with Pakistan, sends message to US
content: S. Jaishankar firmly stated that talks with Pakistan are contingent on addressing terrorism, emphasizing the need for them to dismantle terror infrastructure and act on the provided list of terrorists. He also mentioned that the Indus Waters Treaty will remain suspended until cross-border terrorism ceases.

title: From Kashmir to tariffs: How India is calling Trump's bluff
content: India is escalating its trade disputes with the US, challenging tariffs at the WTO and signaling a shift from defense to offense. Inspired by China's tactics and triggered by Trump's claims of brokering a ceasefire with Pakistan, India asserts its strategic autonomy. New Delhi prioritizes signaling strength and diversifying trade relationships amid ongoing tensions with Washington.

title: Op Sindoor: How IAF's decoy jets, BrahMos barrage crippled Pak's air defences
content: In a retaliatory move following a terror attack, the Indian Air Force launched Operation Sindoor, employing BrahMos missiles to cripple Pakistani airbases. The precision strikes, targeting critical infrastructure, effectively paralyzed Pakistan's air defense and strike capabilities.

title: SP leader sparks row with caste remark on Wg Cmd Vyomika Singh
content: Ramgopal Yadav, a senior SP leader, ignited controversy with casteist remarks about Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, following similar outrage over comments targeting Colonel Sofiya Qureshi.

title: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warns: ‘India is at the epicentre of the global…’
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath expressed concern over rising soft drink consumption in India, linking it to the country's diabetes epidemic. He highlighted alarming statistics, including the high risk for young adults and lack of awareness. Kamath emphasized the need for public awareness, insurance coverage, early detection programs, and lifestyle changes to combat this growing health crisis.

title: 'I helped': Trump changes tune on India-Pak ceasefire talks
content: Donald Trump again claimed to have mediated a ceasefire between India and Pakistan following India's Operation Sindoor, sparked by a terror attack. Trump stated he encouraged trade talks to de-escalate the conflict, but India has denied any US mediation, reaffirming that discussions with Pakistan will only address terrorism and the return of Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, emphasizing a strictly bilateral approach.

title: India’s first monthly job survey shows 5.1% unemployment rate in April 2025
content: India's unemployment rate reached 5.1% in April 2025, according to the first monthly labour force data released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation. The survey, based on the Current Weekly Status, revealed a higher unemployment rate among youth aged 15-29 years, especially young women in urban areas. The Labour Force Participation Rate stood at 55.6% nationally.

title: India cancels security clearance of Turkish firm amid rising tensions
content: The Indian government has revoked the security clearance of Celebi Airport Services India, a subsidiary of Turkey's Celebi Aviation, citing national security concerns. This action will disrupt ground handling operations at key airports, including Delhi, Bengaluru, and Hyderabad. The decision follows growing unease within the security establishment regarding Turkey's perceived support for Pakistan, particularly after recent events.

title: Microsoft's second biggest job cuts: Coders, managers, & others asked to leave
content: Microsoft's recent layoffs disproportionately affected software engineers, with over 40% of Washington state cuts hitting coding professionals. Project management roles also saw significant impact as the company invests heavily in AI, which is automating aspects of software development.

title: Pak offers zero-tariff trade deal to US amid Trump's big claim on India
content: Amidst ongoing trade negotiations between the US and India, Pakistan has proposed a zero-tariff bilateral trade agreement to the United States, aiming to boost trade across various sectors. The US remains India's largest trading partner, with substantial bilateral trade volume.

title: In a 1st, India to conduct experiments aboard ISS to study life in space
content: India is poised to conduct its first biological experiment on the International Space Station (ISS), focusing on the sustainability of human life in space. Spearheaded by Isro and the Department of Biotechnology, the Axiom-4 mission will include astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla. The experiments will analyze algal species' growth and cyanobacteria's response to microgravity, potentially identifying suitable species for space environments.

title: Amazon layoffs: 'As part of our ongoing work to make our teams ...,' says company
content: Amazon has reportedly laid off 100 employees from its Devices and Services division, responsible for popular products like Echo and Ring. The company cites efficiency improvements and alignment with its product roadmap as reasons. CEO Andy Jassy is focused on cutting bureaucracy and rewarding employees who achieve more with fewer resources.

title: Former India coach reveals conversation with Virat Kohli
content: Ravi Shastri disclosed his discussion with Virat Kohli before Kohli's unexpected Test retirement. Kohli, India's fourth-highest Test run-scorer, retired despite an upcoming series against England. Shastri and Kohli discussed the decision a week prior. Shastri acknowledged Kohli's intense approach and global impact. He emphasized Kohli's achievements, stating Kohli had nothing left to achieve in his career.

title: Gift diplomacy: Inside tiny Gulf nation's quest to woo Trump
content: Qatar's influence in America faces scrutiny. The Gulf state's economic power funds its presence in US military, academia, politics, media, and business. Qatar is a major donor to US universities and spends millions on lobbying. Its wealth fund invests in US infrastructure. Critics raise concerns about academic freedom and foreign policy influence.

title: Mayank Yadav breaks down again, ruled out of IPL 2025
content: Mayank Yadav's injury woes continue as a back injury has sidelined him for the rest of the 2025 IPL season. Lucknow Super Giants have signed New Zealand's William O'Rourke as his replacement. Yadav, who has a history of injuries, managed only two games this season, picking up two wickets.

title: Matthew Stafford points out that the Detroit Lions lost out on some coordinators
content: Matthew Stafford anticipates a competitive game against the Detroit Lions in December 2025, acknowledging their progress under Dan Campbell and Jared Goff. Reflecting on past encounters, Stafford notes the Lions' coaching changes, with Ben Johnson and Aaron Glenn departing for head coaching roles with the Chicago Bears and New York Jets, respectively.

title: Trump warns Apple about ‘Make in India’, will Tim Cook listen?
content: Despite Donald Trump's request for Apple to increase manufacturing in the United States, Apple has reaffirmed its commitment to expanding its manufacturing presence in India. Apple executives have assured Indian government officials that their investment plans remain unchanged, with India continuing to be a crucial manufacturing destination.

title: Anaya Bangar recollects interaction with Virat Kohli: 'He’s given me tips'
content: Anaya Bangar, child of Sanjay Bangar, revealed the experience of training with Virat Kohli and invaluable advice Indian legend gave on handling pressure. Kohli shared his approach, emphasizing the importance of deeply understanding and trusting one's strengths through rigorous practice. Anaya highlighted Kohli's guidance, noting how self-awareness and confidence in one's game are crucial for success at the highest level.

title: 'Leadership is about character': R Ashwin on selecting next Test captain
content: Indian cricket faces a transition as Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's Test retirements mark a new era. Selectors are tasked with rebuilding the team, potentially starting with Shubman Gill in the upcoming England series. Ravichandran Ashwin emphasizes the importance of character in leadership, suggesting a thorough evaluation process for selecting the next captain, similar to the Australian method.

title: Why Trump's message to Apple CEO maybe bad news for India
content: Donald Trump has expressed his disapproval to Tim Cook regarding Apple's increasing manufacturing presence in India, amidst the company's efforts to diversify away from China due to tariffs and diplomatic tensions. Trump wants Apple to increase manufacturing operations in the United States.

title: Who should captain India Test team? R Ashwin picks his first choice
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has endorsed Jasprit Bumrah as his top choice to succeed Rohit Sharma as India's Test captain, citing Bumrah's leadership qualities on his YouTube channel. Despite concerns over workload management, Ashwin expressed disappointment if Bumrah isn't considered.

title: Jayson Tatum trolled after hospital post goes viral following injury and surgery
content: Jayson Tatum's potential postseason absence due to a recent injury has sparked mixed reactions. While some fans mock his hospital bed photo, accusing him of faking, others offer support and prayers for a speedy recovery. Al Horford expressed concern for Tatum's well-being amidst the Celtics' playoff series against the Knicks, who currently lead 3-2.

title: Preity Zinta reacts to Bollywood's silence during India-Pakistan conflict
content: Amidst discussions on the recent ceasefire and Operation Sindoor, Preity Zinta addressed the silence of Bollywood celebrities regarding the Pahalgam terror attack. As a 'Fauji kid,' she expressed that such events deeply affect her. Zinta highlighted the sacrifices of military families, emphasizing their strength and resilience. During the AMA session, she also shared lighthearted moments, advising fans to embrace imperfections.

title: AB de Villiers reveals his initial dislike for Virat Kohli
content: AB de Villiers revealed his initial dislike for Virat Kohli stemmed from their fierce competitiveness on the field. This transformed into a deep friendship when they became teammates at RCB in the IPL. Their partnership became legendary, marked by record-breaking runs and a mutual understanding that transcended the game, forging a bond of brotherhood.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo leads Forbes 2025 list of highest-paid athletes
content: Cristiano Ronaldo has clinched the top spot on Forbes' list of highest-paid athletes for 2025, amassing a staggering $275 million. This figure represents the third-highest annual earning for any athlete in Forbes' history. His substantial income is fueled by a lucrative salary with Al Nassr and diverse off-field ventures, solidifying his status as a global icon.

title: Cong questions 'total chuppi' from PM Modi on Trump's 'zero-tariff' claim
content: The Congress party is demanding answers from Prime Minister Modi regarding President Trump's claim that India has offered a "zero-tariff deal" to the United States. Jairam Ramesh questioned the Prime Minister's silence and the connection to the "Operation Sindoor" stoppage. Manish Tewari insists on an explicit response from the government.

title: Former Australian cricketer says IPL and PSL should 'end now'
content: IPL 2025 will restart on Saturday. Royal Challengers Bengaluru will face Kolkata Knight Riders. The tournament was paused due to India-Pakistan tensions. The restart follows a ceasefire. BCCI is urging foreign players to return. Safety concerns remain after the hostilities. The final match is now scheduled for June 3. Uncertainty surrounds foreign players' return for the second leg.

title: Sensex 1,200 points up: Top 5 reasons for bulls' party
content: Stock market today: Indian stock markets surged, with Nifty50 surpassing 25,000 and Sensex closing above 82,000, fueled by optimism surrounding potential US-India trade deals and declining oil and gold prices.

title: How rich is French superstar Kylian Mbappe and Real Madrid’s new signing?
content: Kylian Mbappé's move to Real Madrid has solidified his position as a football superstar and a financial powerhouse. Despite taking a pay cut from his PSG contract, Mbappé earns £250,000 weekly, supplemented by a lucrative signing bonus.

title: Op Sindoor: India demonstrated tech edge by beating Pak’s Chinese systems
content: India successfully conducted strikes against terror hubs, bypassing Pakistan's air defenses. The Indian Air Force also thwarted multiple retaliatory missile and drone attacks. Indigenous air defence network played a crucial role during the hostilities. The armed forces are on high alert, maintaining operational readiness. India is adhering to the bilateral understanding to cease military action.

title: Trump says India has offered a trade deal with ‘literally no tariffs’
content: Donald Trump has claimed India's proposal for a trade agreement with "no tariffs". This move comes as India seeks a trade deal with the U.S. amidst Trump's 90-day suspension of tariff increases, which previously included a 26% duty on Indian goods.

title: Fans lose it as Toronto Maple Leafs implode in Game 5 rout to Florida Panthers
content: Following a crushing 6-1 defeat against the Florida Panthers in Game 5, Toronto Maple Leafs fans have reached a breaking point. The internet exploded with anger directed at Auston Matthews, fueled by playoff underperformance and high expectations. From jersey throwing to scathing online commentary, the fanbase's frustration is palpable as the team faces elimination.

title: 'If you can train someone, why not Jadeja': Ashwin on India's Test captain
content: With Virat Kohli's retirement, Team India faces crucial decisions regarding Test leadership and the number four batting position. While Shubman Gill is a potential candidate for both roles, Ravichandran Ashwin suggests considering Ravindra Jadeja for captaincy. Ashwin highlights Jadeja's experience and leadership potential, drawing from his CSK captaincy stint.

title: The controversy surrounding Rohit Bal’s will: A legacy shrouded in mystery
content: Following Rohit Bal's untimely death, a controversy erupted over a purported will presented by Lalit Tehlan. Doubts arose regarding the will's authenticity, with handwriting analysis suggesting forgery and key figures, like Sunil Sethi, denying any knowledge of it.

title: 'Rok sako to rok lo': Rahul's message to PM Modi, Nitish Kumar in Bihar
content: Rahul Gandhi faced police obstruction en route to Ambedkar hostel in Darbhanga, where he planned to engage with students at a 'Shiksha Nyay Samvad' event. Despite the attempts to stop him, Gandhi entered the premises and criticized the Bihar government as a "Double Engine Dhokebaaz Sarkaar," vowing to implement social justice measures if his party comes to power.

title: Rohit vs Virat: Former South Africa cricketer makes a huge statement
content: Herschelle Gibbs ignited a social media debate by asserting that Rohit Sharma possesses a superior technique compared to Virat Kohli. Gibbs emphasized Rohit's technical correctness, particularly his defensive prowess, while acknowledging Kohli's dominance and aggressive approach, especially in white-ball cricket. This comparison sparked considerable discussion among fans, contrasting the two Indian batting stalwarts.

title: Tom Brady spurs early roster shake-up at Las Vegas Raiders: Three players released
content: Tom Brady's increasing presence within the Las Vegas Raiders is already triggering substantial changes. The team released Amari Burney, Matthew Butler, and Justin Marshall, signaling an early roster overhaul. Insiders suggest Brady's voice is pushing for higher standards, aiming to cultivate a stronger competitive environment and rebuild a winning culture within the team.

title: From Nushrratt Bharuccha to Ileana D'Cruz: Why heroines get replaced in sequels
content: Bollywood sequels often replace actresses. Male leads usually stay. Female actors are recast for new stories or market trends. Nushrratt Bharuccha was replaced in Dream Girl 2. Ileana D'Cruz was replaced in Raid 2. Actresses like Shreya Gupto discuss the business side. This practice shows gender bias. It also highlights the importance of box-office success in Indian cinema.

title: Neeraj Chopra speaks on relationship with Arshad Nadeem
content: Neeraj Chopra addressed his relationship with Arshad Nadeem. He mentioned the impact of India-Pakistan relations on their interactions. Chopra is set to compete in the Doha Diamond League. He will face strong competition from Anderson Peters and Jakub Vadlejch. Kishore Jena, another Indian athlete, will also participate. Chopra aims to reclaim the Doha DL title, having won it in 2023.

title: 18 Haryana schools record 0% pass rate in Class 12 boards examination
content: The Haryana Board of School Education (HBSE) has flagged 100 underperforming schools, including 18 with a zero percent pass rate in the Class 12 board exams, to the Directorate of Education. The HBSE chairman, Dr. Pawan Kumar, emphasized the need for teacher training and engagement with students and parents to address the causes of the poor results and improve performance.
